text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition SatuSehatChargeItem

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ChargeItem 0..*ChargeItemItem containing charge code(s) associated with the provision of healthcare provider products
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:unitPrice 0..*MoneyUnit Price
URL: https://fhir.kemkes.go.id/r4/StructureDefinition/UnitPrice
extension:totalPrice 0..*MoneyTotal Price
URL: https://fhir.kemkes.go.id/r4/StructureDefinition/TotalPrice
extension:chargeItemResponse 0..1(Complex)Charge Item Response
URL: https://fhir.kemkes.go.id/r4/StructureDefinition/ChargeItemResponse
identifier 0..1IdentifierBusiness Identifier for item
definitionUri 0..1uriDefining information about the code of this charge item
definitionCanonical 0..1canonical(ChargeItemDefinition)Resource defining the code of this ChargeItem
status 1..1codeplanned | billable | not-billable | aborted | billed | entered-in-error | unknown
partOf 0..1Reference(ChargeItem)Part of referenced ChargeItem
code 1..1CodeableConceptA code that identifies the charge, like a billing code
coding 0..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
subject 1..1Reference(Patient | Group)Individual service was done for/to
context 0..1Reference(Encounter | EpisodeOfCare)Encounter / Episode associated with event
Slices for occurrence[x] 0..1dateTime, Period, TimingWhen the charged service was applied
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
occurrence[x]:occurrenceDateTime 0..1dateTimeWhen the charged service was applied
occurrence[x]:occurrencePeriod 0..1PeriodWhen the charged service was applied
occurrence[x]:occurrenceTiming 0..1TimingWhen the charged service was applied
performer 0..1BackboneElementWho performed charged service
function 0..1CodeableConceptWhat type of performance was done
coding 0..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
actor 1..1Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | CareTeam | Patient | Device | RelatedPerson)Individual who was performing
performingOrganization 0..1Reference(Organization)Organization providing the charged service
requestingOrganization 0..1Reference(Organization)Organization requesting the charged service
costCenter 0..1Reference(Organization)Organization that has ownership of the (potential, future) revenue
quantity 0..1QuantityQuantity of which the charge item has been serviced
bodysite 0..1CodeableConceptAnatomical location, if relevant
coding 0..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
factorOverride 0..1decimalFactor overriding the associated rules
priceOverride 0..1MoneyPrice overriding the associated rules
overrideReason 0..1stringReason for overriding the list price/factor
enterer 0..1Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | Patient | Device | RelatedPerson)Individual who was entering
enteredDate 0..1dateTimeDate the charge item was entered
reason 0..1CodeableConceptWhy was the charged service rendered?
coding 0..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
service 0..1Reference(DiagnosticReport | ImagingStudy | Immunization | MedicationAdministration | MedicationDispense | Observation | Procedure | SupplyDelivery)Which rendered service is being charged?
Slices for product[x] 0..1Reference(Device | Medication | Substance), CodeableConceptProduct charged
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
product[x]:productCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptProduct charged
product[x]:productReference 0..1Reference(Device | Medication | Substance)Product charged
account 0..1Reference(Account)Account to place this charge
note 0..1AnnotationComments made about the ChargeItem
supportingInformation 0..1Reference(Resource)Further information supporting this charge

Documentation for this format

name: SatuSehatChargeItem
title: Satu Sehat Charge Item
description: Defines the ID Core constraints and extensions on the ChargeItem resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve Charged Items information.

element.short: Item containing charge code(s) associated with the provision of healthcare provider products
element.definition: The resource ChargeItem describes the provision of healthcare provider products for a certain patient, therefore referring not only to the product, but containing in addition details of the provision, like date, time, amounts and participating organizations and persons. Main Usage of the ChargeItem is to enable the billing process and internal cost allocation.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Berisi data biaya atau tarif tindakan dan layanan dengan tipe data Money.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Berisi data total biaya atau tarif tindakan dan layanan dengan tipe data Money.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Berisi data respon persetujuan tindakan dan layanan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.definition: Berisi data ID lokal terkait program yang dijalankan dengan tipe data Identifier.
element.requirements: Allows identification of the charge Item as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defining information about the code of this charge item
element.definition: Berisi data referensi sumber informasi harga (eksternal), aturan penerapan untuk kode yang digunakan ChargeItem dengan tipe data uri.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Resource defining the code of this ChargeItem
element.definition: Berisi data referensi sumber informasi harga, aturan aplikasi untuk kode yang digunakan ChargeItem dengan tipe data canonical.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: planned | billable | not-billable | aborted | billed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: Berisi data yang menyatakan status ChargeItem saat ini dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi ChargeItemStatus.
element.comment:
Unknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply.  Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.

This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the charge item as not currently valid.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a ChargeItem.

element.definition: Berisi data ChargeItem dapat dikelompokkan ke ChargeItem yang lebih besar yang mencakup seluruh rangkaian dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource ChargeItem.
element.requirements: E.g. Drug administration as part of a procedure, procedure as part of observation, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A code that identifies the charge, like a billing code
element.definition: Berisi kode untuk mengidentifikasi tagihan, misalnya kode billing, dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Example set of codes that can be used for billing purposes.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.definition: Berisi kode untuk mengidentifikasi tagihan, misalnya kode billing, dengan tipe data Coding, yang nilainya dapat mengacu pada contoh data terminologi Charge Item Code.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

element.definition: Berisi data perangkat, praktisi, dan lain-lain yang melakukan atau berpartisipasi dalam layanan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | HealthcareService | CareTeam | Patient | Device | RelatedPerson.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data organisasi yang melakukan layanan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization.
element.comment: Practitioners and Devices can be associated with multiple organizations. It has to be made clear, on behalf of which Organization the services have been rendered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data organisasi yang meminta layanan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization.
element.comment: The rendered Service might not be associated with a Request. This property indicates which Organization requested the services to be rendered. (In many cases, this may just be the Department associated with the Encounter.location).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Organization that has ownership of the (potential, future) revenue
element.definition: Berisi data pusat biaya keuangan yang memungkinkan pelacakan atribusi biaya dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization.
element.comment: The costCenter could either be given as a reference to an Organization(Role) resource or as the identifier of the cost center determined by Reference.identifier.value and Reference.identifier.system, depending on use case requirements.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quantity of which the charge item has been serviced
element.definition: Berisi data kuantitas item tagihan yang telah dilayani dengan tipe data Quantity.
element.comment: In many cases this may just be a value, if the underlying units are implicit in the definition of the charge item code.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data lokasi anatomi tubuh di mana layanan terkait telah diterapkan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.comment: Only used if not implicit in code found in Condition.code. If the use case requires attributes from the BodySite resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [bodySite](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-bodysite.html).  May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.definition: Berisi data lokasi anatomi tubuh di mana layanan terkait telah diterapkan dengan tipe data Coding. Nilainya mengacu pada SNOMED CT Body Structures.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.definition: Berisi data terkait pemotongan biaya yang telah ditentukan dengan aturan yang terkait dengan kode dengan tipe data decimal.
element.comment: There is no reason to carry the factor in the instance of a ChargeItem unless special circumstances require a manual override. The factors are usually defined by a set of rules in a back catalogue of the billing codes  (see ChargeItem.definition). Derived profiles may require a ChargeItem.overrideReason to be provided if either factor or price are manually overridden.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data harga total untuk item yang dapat ditagih, memperhitungkan kuantitas dengan tipe data Money.
element.comment: There is no reason to carry the price in the instance of a ChargeItem unless circumstances require a manual override. The list prices or are usually defined in a back catalogue of the billing codes  (see ChargeItem.definition). Derived profiles may require a ChargeItem.overrideReason to be provided if either factor or price are manually overridden.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Reason for overriding the list price/factor
element.definition: Berisi data alasan tindakan jika daftar harga atau faktor berbasis aturan yang terkait dengan kode diganti dengan tipe data yang digunakan adalah string.
element.comment: Derived Profiles may choose to add invariants requiring this field to be populated if either priceOverride or factorOverride have been filled.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data perangkat, praktisi, dan lain-lain yang memasukkan data item biaya dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | CareTeam | Patient | Device | RelatedPerson.
element.comment: The enterer is also the person considered responsible for factor/price overrides if applicable.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Date the charge item was entered
element.definition: Berisi data tanggal item biaya ketika dimasukkan dengan tipe data dateTime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD atau YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
element.comment: The actual date when the service associated with the charge has been rendered is captured in occurrence[x].

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Why was the charged  service rendered?
element.definition: Berisi data alasan suatu peristiwa terjadi dalam bentuk kode atau tekstual dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.comment: If the application of the charge item requires a reason to be given, it can be captured here. Textual reasons can be captured using reasonCode.text.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: Berisi data alasan suatu peristiwa terjadi dalam bentuk kode atau tekstual dengan tipe data Coding. Nilainya mengacu pada ICD-10 Codes.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: Which rendered service is being charged?
element.definition: Berisi data layanan yang diberikan yang menyebabkan tagihan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource DiagnosticReport | ImagingStudy | Immunization | MedicationAdministration | MedicationDispense | Observation | Procedure | ServiceRequest | SupplyDelivery.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data perangkat, makanan, obat-obatan, atau produk lain yang sedang ditagihkan baik dengan kode jenis atau referensi ke sebuah instans.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data perangkat, makanan, obat-obatan, atau produk lain yang sedang ditagihkan baik dengan kode jenis atau referensi ke sebuah instans dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data perangkat, makanan, obat-obatan, atau produk lain yang sedang ditagihkan baik dengan kode jenis atau referensi ke sebuah instans dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Device | Medication | Substance.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data akun untuk menempatkan ChargeItem dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Account.
element.comment: Systems posting the ChargeItems might not always be able to determine, which accounts the Items need to be places into. It is up to the postprocessing Financial System to apply internal rules to decide based on the Encounter/EpisodeOfCare/Patient/Coverage context and the type of ChargeItem, which Account is appropriate.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data komentar yang dibuat tentang peristiwa oleh petugas yang melakukan, subjek atau peserta lainnya dengan tipe data Annotation.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data informasi lebih lanjut yang mendukung tagihan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Any.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data biaya atau tarif tindakan dan layanan dengan tipe data Money.
Berisi data total biaya atau tarif tindakan dan layanan dengan tipe data Money.
Berisi data respon persetujuan tindakan dan layanan.
Berisi data ID lokal terkait program yang dijalankan dengan tipe data Identifier.
Berisi data referensi sumber informasi harga (eksternal), aturan penerapan untuk kode yang digunakan ChargeItem dengan tipe data uri.
Berisi data referensi sumber informasi harga, aturan aplikasi untuk kode yang digunakan ChargeItem dengan tipe data canonical.
Berisi data yang menyatakan status ChargeItem saat ini dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi ChargeItemStatus.
Berisi data ChargeItem dapat dikelompokkan ke ChargeItem yang lebih besar yang mencakup seluruh rangkaian dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource ChargeItem.
Berisi kode untuk mengidentifikasi tagihan, misalnya kode billing, dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi kode untuk mengidentifikasi tagihan, misalnya kode billing, dengan tipe data Coding, yang nilainya dapat mengacu pada contoh data terminologi Charge Item Code.
Berisi data pasien yang telah dilakukan tindakan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Patient | Group.
Berisi data terkait kunjungan yang perlu ditagihkan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Encounter | EpisodeOfCare.
Berisi data informasi tanggal/waktu atau durasi saat layanan yang dikenakan biaya diterapkan.

Berisi data informasi tanggal/waktu atau durasi saat layanan yang dikenakan biaya diterapkan dengan tipe data dateTime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD atau YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
Berisi data informasi tanggal/waktu atau durasi saat layanan yang dikenakan biaya diterapkan dengan tipe data Period.
Berisi data informasi tanggal/waktu atau durasi saat layanan yang dikenakan biaya diterapkan dengan tipe data Timing.
Berisi data yang menjelaskan jenis kinerja atau partisipasi (misalnya ahli bedah utama, ahli anestesi) dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data yang menjelaskan jenis kinerja atau partisipasi (misalnya ahli bedah utama, ahli anestesi) dengan tipe data CodeableConcept, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi Procedure Performer Role Codes.

Berisi data perangkat, praktisi, dan lain-lain yang melakukan atau berpartisipasi dalam layanan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | HealthcareService | CareTeam | Patient | Device | RelatedPerson.
Berisi data organisasi yang melakukan layanan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization.
Berisi data organisasi yang meminta layanan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization.
Berisi data pusat biaya keuangan yang memungkinkan pelacakan atribusi biaya dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization.
Berisi data kuantitas item tagihan yang telah dilayani dengan tipe data Quantity.
Berisi data lokasi anatomi tubuh di mana layanan terkait telah diterapkan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data lokasi anatomi tubuh di mana layanan terkait telah diterapkan dengan tipe data Coding. Nilainya mengacu pada SNOMED CT Body Structures.
Berisi data terkait pemotongan biaya yang telah ditentukan dengan aturan yang terkait dengan kode dengan tipe data decimal.
Berisi data harga total untuk item yang dapat ditagih, memperhitungkan kuantitas dengan tipe data Money.
Berisi data alasan tindakan jika daftar harga atau faktor berbasis aturan yang terkait dengan kode diganti dengan tipe data yang digunakan adalah string.

Berisi data perangkat, praktisi, dan lain-lain yang memasukkan data item biaya dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | CareTeam | Patient | Device | RelatedPerson.
Berisi data tanggal item biaya ketika dimasukkan dengan tipe data dateTime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD atau YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
Berisi data alasan suatu peristiwa terjadi dalam bentuk kode atau tekstual dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data alasan suatu peristiwa terjadi dalam bentuk kode atau tekstual dengan tipe data Coding. Nilainya mengacu pada ICD-10 Codes.

Berisi data layanan yang diberikan yang menyebabkan tagihan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource DiagnosticReport | ImagingStudy | Immunization | MedicationAdministration | MedicationDispense | Observation | Procedure | ServiceRequest | SupplyDelivery.
Berisi data perangkat, makanan, obat-obatan, atau produk lain yang sedang ditagihkan baik dengan kode jenis atau referensi ke sebuah instans.
Berisi data perangkat, makanan, obat-obatan, atau produk lain yang sedang ditagihkan baik dengan kode jenis atau referensi ke sebuah instans dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data perangkat, makanan, obat-obatan, atau produk lain yang sedang ditagihkan baik dengan kode jenis atau referensi ke sebuah instans dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Device | Medication | Substance.
Berisi data akun untuk menempatkan ChargeItem dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Account.
Berisi data komentar yang dibuat tentang peristiwa oleh petugas yang melakukan, subjek atau peserta lainnya dengan tipe data Annotation.
Berisi data informasi lebih lanjut yang mendukung tagihan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Any.
